meanings.definition: A person who harvests or gathers crops in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The bushelmen worked hard in the fields to collect the ripe corn.
meanings.sent2: The village relied on the bushelmen to bring in the harvest every year.
meanings.sent3: The bushelmen had a race to see who could gather the most apples in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The bushelmen were like busy bees, buzzing from field to field to gather the crops.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bushelmen toiling under the hot sun stayed with him for days.

meanings.definition: A group of people who work together to collect and store grain.
meanings.sent1: The bushelmen gathered around the barn to discuss the upcoming harvest.
meanings.sent2: The community formed a team of bushelmen to ensure all the grain was stored properly.
meanings.sent3: The bushelmen threw a party after successfully storing the entire harvest.
meanings.sent4: The bushelmen were like a well-oiled machine, efficiently storing the grain.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the bushelmen working together was a true display of teamwork.
